definition: variant of 漂流[piao1 liu2]
variant of 飄|飘[piao1]
to float
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: Fugue world dream of a millennium?
I usually elect to play mind games with any suspected fish before beginning a new drift.
sentences.chinese: 我通常选择于开始一次新飘流前跟可疑的鱼儿斗斗智。

sentences.english: Many vagabonds gathered at the back of this restaurant to find food.
sentences.chinese: 很多飘流汉会萃在这家餐厅的后面找寻食品。

sentences.english: And I float everywhere at sea.
sentences.chinese: 海风吹，海浪涌，随我飘流四方。

sentences.english: The empty boat drifted on the sea.

definition: variant of 飄盪|飘荡[piao1 dang4]
drift
to float on the current/to drift along or about/rafting
variant of 漂泊[piao1 bo2]
to drift (in the tide)/to rove/to lead a wandering existence/drifter/wanderer
to drift with the waves
to float/to tramp/to rove
to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
small boat/skiff
to float away/to drift/to be swept off
white water rafter/paddler/river runner
to float/to hover/also written 漂浮
variant of 飄零|飘零[piao1 ling2]
floating in the wind/swaying/tottering/unstable
to float/to drift/to wander/variant of 蜉蝣[fu2 you2]
to overturn (a vehicle)/to capsize/to turn upside down/to change completely
